featured.text: Daphne has been working with wild animals for some 60 years, and in 1977 she opened the elephant orphanage at her home in Nairobi.
As of 1997, the orphanage, which depends on private contributions, has saved more than 100 infants.

Zoe was rather healthy when she was found, and once under the care of the orphanage she was very happy, consuming six gallons of vitamin-rich milk a day and earning a reputation as a confident, naughty and mischievous youngster.
Those college students work at the orphanage on a _____ basis, helping the children with their studies without receiving any pay.

other.text: After a year in the orphanage with the constant companionship of her human family, Zoe was taken to a refuge at Tsavo National Park.
So she was trucked to a most unusual orphanage in Nairobi, run by a woman named Daphne Sheldrick.
Zoe was trucked to an elephant orphanage because ________.

definition.zh_def: 孤兒院：收容無父母或無法照顧的兒童的機構。
definition.en_def: A facility that provides care and shelter for children who are orphaned or whose parents are unable to care for them.
definition.example: The children at the orphanage were excited to receive new toys for the holidays.
